title.narrative: 3.3 : IMPROVING LEARNING OUTCOMES/ EMPLOYABILITY FOR ADOLESCENTS.

description.narrative: Secondary schools and catalytic vocational training centres in priority regions, have improved learning outcomes in a protective and clean environment to retain more girls and boys, including those with disabilities, and boost their employability.,which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Skills Development, Skills Development (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescent girls and boys aged 13 to 18 years are increasingly empowered and able to access social services adapted to their needsand effectively participate in socioeconomic decision-making, including in humanitarian situations.

mailing-address.narrative: BP 96 Niamakoro Route de l'Aeroport Bamako

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) secondary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of secondary education teacher training
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
Provision or procurement of secondary education learning materials
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
